title: Whitman Mission National Historic Site: Ch. 3: Legislation Since 1936
body: Chapter Three: Amendatory Legislation Since 1936       For years the National Park Service managed the Whitman National Monument without any other legislation than the 1936 Act of Congress (49 Stat. 2028). It became obvious by 1952, however, that to provide for the Park's changing needs and future objectives, amendatory legislation was required. The ensuing legislation resulted in both positive and significant change.
